meanings.sent1: After the meeting ended, they decided to reinvoke the discussion to clarify some points.
meanings.sent2: The magician could reinvoke the disappearing act flawlessly every time.
meanings.sent3: When the cat refused to come inside, Sarah tried to reinvoke its love for treats.
meanings.sent4: The old clock tower seemed to reinvoke memories of a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's story managed to reinvoke the students' interest in history.

meanings.definition: Bring back into use or existence
meanings.sent1: The town council voted to reinvoke an old law that prohibited loud music after midnight.
meanings.sent2: The antique shop owner decided to reinvoke the tradition of handwritten receipts.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to reinvoke the forgotten recipe for the special dish.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rainstorm seemed to reinvoke the need for umbrellas in the city.
meanings.sent5: The new technology aims to reinvoke interest in classic literature among young readers.

meanings.definition: To summon back into action or existence
meanings.sent1: The general planned to reinvoke the elite troops for a crucial mission.
meanings.sent2: The emergency protocol allowed them to reinvoke the evacuation plan swiftly.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's sidekick tried to reinvoke the hero's courage during the battle.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ritual was believed to reinvoke the spirits of the ancestors.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speaker's words managed to reinvoke hope in the audience.
